intro: Codonoprasum paniculatum, commonly known as the panicled codonostemon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in panicles. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
